review: I took this medication for about 8 months, while taking care of my mother who was terminally ill and needed nearly 24/7 care. I’m 22. To have to do this during the pandemic (though I had help from my family) was not great for my mental health, which was already bad. Did Lexapro help? Yes. It also helped a lot for my anxiety, which sometimes felt very debilitating. I was able to take a low dose and still see the effects (around 5mg). Sadly though, the medication made me gain weight. No matter how small the dose, I still gained weight almost every week. I didn’t eat any differently from before, but I ended up gaining almost 20 pounds so I had to stop. Now I feel like I desperately need to get back on meds, but don’t know what to do. I do not want to gain more weight, so sadly don’t think I can go back to this drug :( Hope others experience is not the same.

It’s brought me back from a pretty big depressive episode.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was prescribed Lexapro for severe long term anxiety and depression. Nausea, loss of appetite, night sweats, bad vivid dreams, changes to taste, dizzy, short term memory loss, inability to orgasm, blurred vision in the morning, heart palpitations, headaches, extreme moments of anxiety to the point of throwing up, extreme depression to the point of having to sleep all day. After about a month the side effects decreased in severity, my anxiety was gone, but still left me with the inability to orgasm and had no impact on my depression.
